author: Staff Reporter
text:
The annual Thiruvoodal festival was held here on Saturday and thousands of devotees witnessed the event.

This is a festival celebrated based on a legend in which Sri Arunachaleswarar, the presiding deity of the famous Shiva temple here and his consort Sri Apeethakuchambal develop bitterness for a trivial reason and they express their anger against one another.

This anger is represented by taking idols of both the lord and his consort in opposite directions in Thiruvoodal Street here on second day of Tamil month Thai that coincides with Mattu Pongal .

At the end of the dramatic event, the idol of lord would be taken to Kumara Koil while idol of his consort would be taken back to Sri Arunachaleswarar temple.

The festival this year was held with traditional fervour and thousands of devotees witnessed the event. The idol of Big Nandhi in Sri Arunachaleswarar Temple has been decorated with vegetables and food stuff in view of Mattu Pongal .

title: Thousands witness Thiruvoodal festival
